title_sort: walt whitman to william sloane kennedy, 3 february 1891
title: Walt Whitman to William Sloane Kennedy, 3 February 1891
text: CamdenFeb: 3 PM '91The worst item is Dr Bucke's bad sickness—see enclosed letter—have not heard any thing since—am uneasy——The proof comes & will be carefully & minutely corrected—some slips & papers will be sent you—also of what is printed in March forthcoming Lippincotts—the trial mulcted B[ucke] 500 but the government has assumed the whole thing—B seems to be as wholly, morally, everyway scatheless as I see it—did I tell you Arther Stedman (dear good invalid, consumptive yn'g fellow) has been to see me?—EC is making g't fixings for the Johns Hopkins lectures—I am having bad times—head, gastric & bladder bad—wet & dark to-day—nights middling fairWalt Whitman Walt Whitman to William Sloane Kennedy, 3 February 1891
